author: Special Correspondent
text:
Frequent traffic bottlenecks are the order of the day in Salem city.

The heavy flow of traffic on the Karur – Namakkal – Salem – Bengaluru national highway between Tiruvagoundanur junction and Sagoserve Junction, and also at the Five Roads junction is to be seen to be believed.

Particularly, the Five Roads Junction frequently witnesses traffic congestion and the police are forced to switch off the automatic signal lights on some occasions to regularise the traffic manually.

The traffic managers and the residents of the city have been demanding construction of flyovers at Five Roads Junction, Tiruvagoundanur junction and AVR roundabout to solve this problem and ensure free flow of traffic.

The Chief Minister on Sunday laid the foundation for construction of a flyover at Five Roads Junction at an outlay of Rs. 320 crore through video-conferencing.
title: Foundation for flyover
